result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin R. Wiatr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin R. Wiatr in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Devin R. Wiatr.  Prosecuting attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: ST called witness KSD Deputy Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Schum. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
At the request of Atty Schum, STC on 10/18/2022 is rescheduled to a Prelim Hearing on 10/20/2022 at 9:30am Intake. DA notified.
to Vacate Status Conference and Set Preliminary Hearing

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devin R. Wiatr in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especailly firearms.   No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Corbett D. Cassandra S. Adrian A.

01:58 PM   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on September 6, 2022 at 08:45 am. $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
